intro: Senecio remyanus, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and thistles. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers surrounded by white ray florets, creating a striking visual display. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Senecio remyanus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
